tweets.text: Plastic sludge is slowly killing an urban river in Hackney . But no officials will take responsibility so volunteers step in such as @julian_kirby and @hmug  https://t.co/9lqFudhqwd - happy to highlight as part of @gbspringclean @KeepBritainTidy

By 2050 there is going to be more plastic than fish in the sea.
If we stop using single use plastic this won‚Äôt become reality  üèäüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
When we stop buying, companies will stop producing.
.
Please Refuse to use single use plastic.
#WeDontDeserveThisPlanet https://t.co/pByr3Wps6y
@Cap_it_off @LiamDeacon @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 https://t.co/ujQfWsOrvl

@amitdelhi15 @pacenvironment @GovernanceOcean @EnvAgency @Economist_WOI @TheOceanCleanup @CIMSEC @IMSC_Sentinel @shippingics @RamdasAthawale @UN well said.!! 
Being sailor, on every ship in every safety meeting I raise point to install RO water purifier plant so that crew will get pure water for free.
Taking water cases from bond making so much plastic onboard. 
Better install RO and give 3-4 bottle to each.

tweets.text: I am very concerned about risk to the chalk aquifer (  vital public water source ) by HS2 tunnelling in the Chilterns. @EnvAgency publish the details of environmental approval application lodged by HS2 Ltd so it can have public scrutiny as a matter of urgency.    @JamesBevanEA https://t.co/emJWODOjOl

@julian_kirby @CraigBennett3 @GeorgeMonbiot @WildLondon @HughFW @lizbonnin @RichMcToffee @GPUKnews 6 of us took this out of 100 yard over 3 sessions. It's got lots of sanitary waste as well a plastic, tarps, and other debris. @EnvAgencySE @thameswater @CRTContactUs all contacted!. Even read recently inspectors saw no sign of sewage!! I can supply new glasses  next time. https://t.co/NjbSbNpu6N
4/ Pls pls hold MPs to account on this. Share local photos, get local media involved and share share share @CraigBennett3 @GeorgeMonbiot @WildLondon @HughFW @lizbonnin @RichMcToffee @GPUKnews
What a day! Such a treat to see brook lamprey spawning today in the Torridge @EnvAgencySW. Counted more than 20! https://t.co/tBCcVdvGC1

Very fine looking 66793 with 1660 City of Truro pass #Branstoncam with the nice palisade fencing courtesy of @EnvAgencyMids which rather wrecks the view.... Think you can do better than that as it‚Äôs not very environmental!!#spottingfromhome @railcamlive https://t.co/xwUI7C3rXw

The @EnvAgency should have taken the thousands of complaints from residents seriously long before now & found the cause. Instead they allow a mountain of filth with seagulls & rats, it‚Äôs bewildering @StinkStopthe https://t.co/ixrBT3AEeT

@HiveThriving @beekeeping_uk @The_RHS @britishbee @Pollinators @EnvAgency @CoventryCAWR @JeffOllerton @WildlifeMag @warleambees @WarksNatBees Great project, I'd be interested to know how you are measuring the environmental particulates, whether local sensors of modelled. We have a widespread PM sensor network but it's not in your area.....yet :)

The radius for the fumes is huge now, 5 miles to Longton, 5 miles to Whitmore Heath & 5 miles to Audley yet no one at @EnvAgency @PHE_uk are saying this is a problem? Send an exec to the site. Take one look at the size of it & tell me it‚Äôs not a problem @StinkStopthe CAP IT OFF https://t.co/TpuxgX0b4F

@SianieRoo @Cap_it_off @maricaoneill @StinkStopthe @Jordbarny90 @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency On Our Fenton, we've been receiving reports of the malodorous fumes being experienced in Longton, Bentilee, Fenton, Blurton etc for months now ü§¢

@Sian29337182 @StinkStopthe @nicolas32140480 @stwater @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency Buck passing again.
Round and round we go 
Where it stops nobody knows 
When will someone pick up the reins and start actually doing something?! üò°üëé

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @ITVCentral you may want to update the story you ran yesterday about Red Industries and #walleys landfill site in Silverdale. The EA have found further breaches and issued an enforcement notice. Red ARE the source of the odour regardless of their diversion tactics @StinkStopthe

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

urls.title: DC Transport & Engineering
urls.description: Just a short email to say how impressed I am with Keltruck‚Äôs recycled truck parts. I dealt with Henry Wood and explained my situation at 3pm in the afternoon and could not believe an engine being delivered to my premises before 10am the following morning. The price was fantastic and Henry was an outstanding representative of Scania in the UK. The engine was delivered on one of their own vehicles and the driver extended the same courtesy as the salesman on the phone. I have always tried to buy pattern parts and from smaller recycling companies but this has been a complete eye opener for me as to cost and service. I have run lorries for over 20 years now and this has completely changed my false view that buying from a dealership is expensive and overpriced. As you have probably noticed I‚Äôm extremely happy and would appreciate it if you could pass my thanks on. Dave Chapman, Founder & owner, DC Transport & Engineering Read more at keltruckscania.com/about-keltruck/customer-testimonials/a.
